awd_titl_txt: Hierarchial-Multiobjective Management of Large Scale        Infrastructure
awd_abstract_narration: This project will investigate the degree and order of importance                of the many parameters affecting the management decisions                       concerning the operation and maintenance of water                               supply/wastewater collection systems.  Parameters include,                      technological, economic, risk assessments, scheduling                           operational, and maintenance considerations.                                                                                                                    The results of this investigation will be useful to managers and                decision makers concerned with the opeation and maintenance of                  public works systems.  These systems have been in place for                     decades and are showing signs of deterioration.  A management                   system is needed in order to plan and schedule the required                     repairs, strengthening or replacement of portions of the system.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
